title: Human cognitive neuroscience data template schema
description: Human cognitive neuroscience data template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

propertyDescriptions.Dataset: Use this section to capture domain-specific information about the dataset, including data modality, acquisition technique, processing stage, domain standards used to arrange and annotate the data, and access information about source data, if available.

About.title: About field schema
About.description: About field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Tips for completing this form

1. Hover the cursor on to show the field description, and onto show the ontological scope assigned to the field.

2. For fields assigned with ontological support, the drop-down menu may contain too many items making it hard to navigate. To ease navigation, enter the first letters of your desired value, the form will attempt to autocomplete your entry with standardized vocabulary. 

3. Some concepts have different expressions, enter several of them if the field does not respond with the correct terminology, i.e. try "functional magnetic resonance imaging" instead of "fMRI".

4. Fields or elements (multiple fields under one heading) that are repeatable are indicated by at the top right corner, use the "Copy" button to duplicate the field or element, or use the "Toggle View" button to call a table view for metadata entry.

5. Leave the field blank if the information is unavailable or not applicable. 

About the metadata template

This metadata template was developed by the research team led by Professor Lucia Melloni at the Max Planck Institute of Empirical Aesthetics. The template was built as part of the Implementing FAIR Workflows Project (TWCF0568), funded by the Templeton World Charity Foundation.

The template aims to generate and share standardized metadata of cognitive neuroscience research projects with human subjects, to enrich publicly accessible domain-specific metadata, and subsequently enhance the discoverability/ seaand reusability of the shared resource. 

The template was built with the Center for Expanded Data Annotation and Retrieval (CEDAR) Workbench. Learn more about CEDAR metadata templates here.

Experiment.title: Experiment element schema
Experiment.description: Experiment element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

propertyDescriptions.Clinical Trial: If the dataset is produced during a clinical trial experiment, please provide the link to the trial registration. (Use persistent identifier i.e. DOI when possible.)
propertyDescriptions.Protocol: Description of procedure or list of procedures performed (see protocol.io as reference). Provide link to the publicly accessible record of the protocol, use persistent identifier i.e. DOI if possible.
propertyDescriptions.Research Design: The overall strategy used to carry out research. E.g. Longitudinal study design, Block design, etc.
propertyDescriptions.Area of Research: The central field of research that is intended for study, based on this collected dataset. (e.g. memory, decision-making, consciousness, etc)
propertyDescriptions.Subject: Information about the participants in the experiment.

Area of Research instruction.title: Area of Research instruction field schema
Area of Research instruction.description: Area of Research instruction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content: The central field of research that is intended for study, based on this collected dataset. (e.g. memory, decision-making, consciousness, etc) The field is supported by ontological terms in the Concept category of Cognitive Atlas Ontology. The template will attempt to auto-fill based on the first letters of yoif no direct matching, try to pick one that is closest to your field.

Area of Research instruction.schema:name: Area of Research instruction

Clinical Trial instruction.title: Clinical Trial instruction field schema
Clinical Trial instruction.description: Clinical Trial instruction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content: A clinical trial is a research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. If the dataset is produced during a clinical trial experiment, please provide the link to the trial registration. (Use persistent identifier i.e. DOI when possible.) Leave blank if does not apply.

Clinical Trial instruction.schema:name: Clinical Trial instruction

protocol instruction.title: protocol instruction field schema
protocol instruction.description: protocol instruction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content: An experimental protocol is a description of procedure or list of procedures performed (see protocol.io as reference). Provide a link to the publicly accessible record of the protocol. Use a persistent identifier i.e. DOI if possible. Leave blank if does not apply.

protocol instruction.schema:name: protocol instruction

research design instruction.title: research design instruction field schema

Preregistration instruction.title: Preregistration instruction field schema
Preregistration instruction.description: Preregistration instruction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content: Preregistration is a practice of documenting your research plan at the beginning of your study and storing that plan in a read-only public repository such as OSF Registries or the National Library of Medicine's Clinical Trials Registry. Provide a link to the publicly accessible record of the preregistration. Use a persistent identifier i.e. DOI if possible. Leave blank if does not apply.

Preregistration instruction.schema:name: Preregistration instruction

experimental instruction text.title: experimental instruction text field schema
experimental instruction text.description: experimental instruction text field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
This section captures experiment related information, including general area of research, links to clinical trial registration, experimental protocol, ethics approval, as well as research design, experimental paradigm used, and information about participants in the experiment. 

Please leave the fields blank if the information is unavailable.

Experimental Paradigm instruction.description: Experimental Paradigm instruction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content: The experimental paradigm/ task design employed in the experiment to collect the dataset, e.g., n-back task, attentional blink. The ontological terms accepted in this field are based on the Task category of the Cognitive Atlas Ontology. The template will attempt to auto-complete your entry based on the first letters, please be patient as the system search for acceptable terms. Please leave the field blank if the paradigm you used is not present in the ontology.

propertyDescriptions.Analysis Pipeline: Information about the analysis process used to produce the dataset, or on the dataset. Please provide the link to the documentation describing the analysis process, using DOI when possible. (e.g. Brainlife workflow publication https://brainlife.io/pubs)
propertyDescriptions.Programming Language: The language in which source code is written, intended to executed/run by a software interpreter.
propertyDescriptions.Statistic Model: Statistic tests used in the data analysis.

Programming Language instruction.title: Programming Language instruction field schema
Programming Language instruction.description: Programming Language instruction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
The language in which source code is written, intended to be executed/ran by a software interpreter. Please enter the language of the code that is uploaded along with the dataset.

The field is supported by the Software Ontology, If the language you used is not listed, please use the following field (Programming Language (Other)) to indicate the name of the language.

Programming Language instruction.schema:name: Programming Language instruction

analysis instruction text.title: analysis instruction text field schema
analysis instruction text.description: analysis instruction text field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
This section captures information about analysis pipeline and statistic models used on the processed data, as well as the scripting language of the analysis code. 

In the analysis pipeline field, provide the link/DOI to the workflow resources that document the analysis process. An example is a DOI to a Brainlife workflow publication

analysis instruction text.schema:name: analysis instruction text

Analysis instruction.description: Analysis instruction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19
Analysis instruction.schema:name: Analysis instruction

Dataset.schema:name: Dataset
Dataset.schema:description: Use this section to capture domain-specific information about the dataset, including data modality, acquisition technique, processing stage, domain standards used to arrange and annotate the data, and access information about source data, if available.
